quest.name: For the People
journal: With furrowed brow, Alphinaud carefully considers where best to look next.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: It didn't take long for folks to start moaning after Vauthry left. Now everyone in Eulmore's got something to complain about. Wouldn't want to be in Master Chai's shoes, having to keep that lot happy...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All we know for certain is that Master Chai has shown great concern not only for Eulmore, but its surrounding settlements.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It seems logical, then, that having consulted those within the city walls, he would wish to do the same to those without.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, if you would go and make inquiries in Wright, I shall do likewise in Stilltide. Gatetown I leave to you, Kai-Shirr.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Fair enough. Where should we meet when we've finished?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well...Top Rung would seem to me to be his next most likely destination.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us reconvene there. With any luck, one of us will have stumbled upon him by then, but if not, we will be well situated to continue our search.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: With Vauthry gone, I had hoped things would change for the better, but this place seems little different from before. Perhaps they need more time...

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Don't worry, Forename. I know Gatetown like the back of my hand. If Master Chai's here, I'll find him in no time.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: ...No, the name doesn't ring any bells. But there was a rather dapper-looking Mystel gentleman here not long ago. He wanted to talk about relations between Wright and Eulmore─or rather the lack of them.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: We lost a great many people to their promises of meol and the chance of a lavish life among the free.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: And Vauthry thought to take even more from us, conscripting the few able-bodied men we had left to guard his paradise.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: I needn't tell you what happened when the sin eaters came... Such things are hard to forgive.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: But Vauthry's gone now, and we're curious to see what will become of Eulmore in his absence.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: That's what I told your friend...Chai-Nuzz, was it? And I'm sure the others said the same. Not what he wanted to hear, I suppose, because he left soon after. And that was that.

dialogue.name: HASTELOT
dialogue.text: I hope we didn't do anything to give him offense, but you can't blame us for being wary. Not after all that's happened. If Eulmore one day shows signs of real change, perhaps we'll lend him a friendlier ear.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Turns out Master Chai was over in Gatetown too. He spoke to a few of the residents, apparently. They told me they'd never seen a posh bloke look so miserable.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So he paid a visit to both Wright and Gatetown as well, did he?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see. Kai-Shirr and I gleaned much the same.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: He seems determined to salvage what goodwill might yet remain among the settlements of Kholusia, the only likely place he has left to go being Amity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Come. If we are quick, we may yet catch up with him.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Forename! Alphinaud! Kai-Shirr! Wh-What are you doing here!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We might ask you the same, Master Chai. We have been looking all over for you.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Looking for me? Whatever for?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lady Chai has been nigh inconsolable in your absence. She claims you disappeared without so much as a word, and bade us return you to her side.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: What in blazes are you talking about? I left a letter for her in our chambers.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Though I suppose she could have overlooked it... And when she gets an idea into her head... <sigh> I can only apologize.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No harm done, Master Chai. But since we are here, might I ask what compelled you to come all this way?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We were told you had been elected mayor, and from what we have gathered from the nearby villages, you have been inquiring about the people's grievances.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Is it safe to assume you mean to take office?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Now, now, let's not jump to conclusions!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I did seek to learn about the problems faced by the people of Kholusia, that much is true. But I am by no means sure I am the man to solve them.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Tackling our many challenges will require resources, and until I have secured them, it would not be right to assume the role of mayor.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see. And you believe said resources can be found here?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Indeed. The people's grievances are many, but in the course of my inquiries, I have already met with several individuals willing to lend their aid in addressing them.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: However, there remains one individual crucial to my plans. A man whose counsel might yet make a mayor of me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: With respect, such forethought is, in itself, proof of your suitability.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The city needs you, Master Chai. And I am certain this man of whom you speak─whoever he may be─will reach the same conclusion. For what little it is worth, we will vouch for you should he require convincing.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Whatever you need, you can count on us.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: We believe in you, Master Chai!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I...I don't know what to say...

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: You don't need to say anything. You've got your actions to speak for you.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: For as long as I can remember, all I ever wanted was to make it into Eulmore. But that dream's gone now, burst like a bubble─or a boil, more like.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Anyway, outside of repaying Master Alphinaud, I haven't had a clue what to do with myself. Spent most days in a daze. But you? You've been running up and down, trying to find a way to fix this mess for everyone.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: And I reckon you can do it. You got this lot up Mt. Gulg, didn't you? How hard could mayoring be? You're going to steer Eulmore to a better future, I know it.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: And I want to help. Properly help. Do something that makes a difference.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: I don't know what it is yet, but I'll work it out on the way. If you let me come with you, that is.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: You give me entirely too much credit, the lot of you...but I can't deny it gives me heart. Come, then. Let us press on together.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Thank you, Master Chai!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: But we mustn't get ahead of ourselves. Eulmore needs more than a man with good intentions. Which is why I am here─to find one with the experience needed to see the city thrive.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Who is this man, exactly, and are you certain he's here in Amity?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Wrenden is his name, and yes, he is. Or was. I had scarcely begun to explain myself when he decided his time was better spent elsewhere.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: He served as chief advisor to Vauthry's father when he was in office.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: If Ran'jit was the mayor's right hand, one might say Wrenden was the left, and between them, they kept Eulmore on the road to prosperity.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: The city needs more than a mere man of business─which is why I must find him.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But even if you do, what makes you think he will listen?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Before giving chase, might it not be wise to speak with those who know him, here in Amity? They may be able to shed some light on his reason for rejecting your overtures out of hand.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Yes, I suppose that makes sense. Perhaps we should start with Tristol, then. As I recall, you made rather a favorable impression on him. I'm certain he would be willing to talk to us.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: I reckon Eulmore could learn a thing or two from Amity about standing on its own two feet. Then again, so could I.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: According to Master Chai, this Wrenden fellow occupied a position of considerable influence in the Eulmoran leadership. Which begs the question: why did he choose to leave?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I realize it was me who suggested speaking with Tristol, but who's to say he will be any more receptive than Wrenden? Why should any of them give me the time of day? ...Bah, that's no way to think. Ignore me.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Greetings, friend. And to you too, Master Chai. I presume you are here to ask after Wrenden? I couldn't help overhearing your earlier...exchange.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Yes, well...with Vauthry gone, Eulmore wants for a leader. Should no one rise to the challenge, the city could very well collapse. I came here seeking Wrenden's counsel in the hope that we could build a better Eulmore together─and that is still my wish. But given how abominably you were mistreated there, I will quite understand if you choose not to help.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Worry not, Master Chai. I bear no grudge against you or the people of Eulmore, and I would not see you suffer for Vauthry's villainy.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: As you no doubt gathered from your meeting earlier, Wrenden can be rather uncompromising. He has his principles, you see, and little patience for anyone he deems less committed to their own.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Your desire to right the wrongs of your past, of Eulmore's past, is quite admirable. But I fear the guilt you bear on the city's behalf works against you.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: I can see it in your eyes, in the way you carry yourself. It goes without saying he sees it as well. You must let those feelings go, Master Chai. Be more assertive─commit to this course─and prove to him Eulmore has the resolve to change.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: The resolve to change...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: I believe he was heading towards Pit 8 when he left. If you plan to go and speak with him, I suggest you be firm and clear in your intentions.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Very well. To Pit 8 we shall go. And I will not take no for an answer. Nay, not even a maybe!

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Despite our previous...artistic differences, I do believe Master Chai means what he says. But until he starts believing it, I fear it won't amount to an awful lot.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Imagine it... A Eulmore that even a bloke like me could help to build...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: People cannot be brought together on the strength of high ideals alone. This I know from painful experience. Wrenden was right to demand proof of Master Chai's commitment.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: It remains to be seen if his words will translate into deeds, but I shall endeavor to keep an open mind.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Ahem! Right, then. Is there a particular issue you would have me resolve?

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: You seem to have conducted an assessment of the problems Eulmore now faces. I assume you will agree, therefore, that the matter of dwindling food stores is the most pressing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, yes... Meol being neither a desirable, nor less sustainable option, I assume alternative foodstuffs are now required to fill the void.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: And a man who hungers is not like to contribute much to society...save violence, perhaps.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: So tell me: how do you propose to solve this problem? Give me a satisfactory answer, and I will consider offering you my counsel.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Hmmm... A combination of measures would seem to be in order. One to address the immediate issue of supply, and another, that of production.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Go on...

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: For the present, Eulmore's coffers can be used to purchase food from our neighbors. This would afford us time to address the underlying problem that affects us all─the long-standing neglect of agriculture.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: The villages that once served as sources of trade for foodstuffs must be repopulated, their means of production restored.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: This assumes, of course, that we can rekindle relations with our neighbors, guarantee security and stability in the region, and most importantly, find people willing to leave the city and take up the rebuilding effort.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: My, my... Think of that all by yourself, did you?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Well...yes. It began as a rather abstract plan I drafted some time ago, after speaking with the peoples of Eulmore and the nearby settlements.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text:
Hmph.
...You've impressed me, Chai-Nuzz.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Uh─ I have? Well, that is a relief!

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Oh, you haven't secured my support just yet. Only my attention. Grand plans will not be enough to persuade the masses. If you would ask them to rebuild, you must provide them the means to do so.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: A fair point, Wrenden. And one to which I have given much thought. I propose the use of Talos to aid in the establishment and maintenance of these settlements. Their employment should drastically improve efficiency, and ultimately increase production.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Talos? But Daedalus Stoneworks closed their doors years ago. Without a ready supply of the necessary equipment, the people would starve before your plans could be put into effect.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Well, as the heir to Daedalus Stoneworks, it just so happens that Talos are my field of expertise.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: And with a little help, I'm quite certain we can acquire what we need in no time at all.
